reviews.title: Product YAY, Service NAY
reviews.review_text: They have either changed the way they make these since the first pack of crew socks I bought, or these are not the same style as those. Either way, they're otherwise what I was looking for. Durable soft socks with "padded" soles that, to a point, actually "massage" your feet. Very comfortable. So, unless I find some other ones, still Hanes of course, I will likely buy more of these in the future. However, I WILL NEVER order directly from Hanes.com again. It seems their left hand doesn't know what the right one is doing. First, my package ships and I get an email about it, but NO tracking info. So, I have to contact them about it and, lo and behold, not 2 days later my package arrives. Finally, A MONTH later, they send me tracking info that leads to UPS where it tells me my package has been delivered. And, here's the kicker, after that same months time, they finally took their payment from my checking account. If not for that, I probably would have given 5 stars. As it is, the product is carrying 3 stars now and the service 1.

reviews.title: Socks seem really large (returned)
reviews.review_text: My 12 yr old son wears a size 9 men's shoe and these socks were big. They are also a really thick sock in case you have a preference.

reviews.title: NOT 100% COTTON AS DESCRIBED
reviews.review_text: These are described as being 100% cotton. They are actually 47% polyester, 43% cotton, 9% rayon, and 1% spandex.

reviews.title: Not big enough
reviews.review_text: I had some Hanes Women's Extended length that were not as big as some other ones I bought years earlier. I purchased Men's Socks thinking the would be bigger. They were just a little bigger, but were not as stretchy and were tighter on the ankles.
I was hoping the socks would be thicker. That's what i thought i was purchasing. I'll still wear them but was really wanting thicker socks.

reviews.title: decent socks but not the same product
reviews.review_text: the oroduct ingot was different then pictured. theres no gray on the socks. theyre completely black. also came in a bag. hopefully it will still work for my husband.

reviews.title: for size 8.5 foot, the heel rides up behind the ft
reviews.review_text: I paid for socks that would fit MY feet (shoe size 8.5). When I put these socks on and then put shoes on, the sock "gives" enough that the heel moves to behind my foot. Correctly labelling the product would have avoided this.

reviews.title: Hanes Mens Socks
reviews.review_text: The socks a thin, there are similar brands on the market for comparable pricing

These socks are nice, thick on the bottom but they are tight around my ankles which swell everyday. I thought may be a mens sock wouldn't be so tight around the ankles beings that men usually have a little thicker ankle than women so I figured that's the standard that manufacturing companies might follow. Other than that they're fine.

reviews.title: They've changed them a little
reviews.review_text: I've been buying these Hanes ankle socks for years but I can tell they've recently changed something in the elastic on them for the ankle part. It's not breaking but it is snugger than it used to be. Not really that big of a deal but I have swelling issues when I'm on my feet all day so that tighter top is making them a little more uncomfortable than they used to be by the end of the day. Overall though still comfy and I'll likely continue to buy them.

reviews.title: Comfortable but super relaxed/baggy fit
reviews.review_text: The sock itself was comfortable, but it kept bunching up and moving positions, wasn't didn't work well with my lower cut sneaker either. For lounging, great...but aside from that not recommended. With that being said, I do have a long and more narrow foot - but never had this issue with a dock before.

reviews.title: Cotton content
reviews.review_text: The version I bought in-store was 76% cotton. What I got online was 43% or so cotton. I bought them specifically because I thought that the same model would have the same cotton content. Instead I now have six pairs of hot plastic for my feet. Gold Toe still uses majority cotton so I'll start replacing with those as these wear out

reviews.title: Need more cushion
reviews.review_text: great socks....just wish they were a little thicker

reviews.title: Make sure no one else wore your socks before you
reviews.review_text: Once I opened the box it was clear that the package of socks had already been opened and re-sealed so I paid full price for used socks. Fit and look are nice I was just surprised that Wal-Mart is now a second hand store!

reviews.title: It's a sock. That's it.
reviews.review_text: Nothing to complain about, but I don't know how long they'll take to wear through. The portion of the sock on the ankle is snug but not tight, so it isn't slipping down.

reviews.title: Item is not the same as pictured.
reviews.review_text: The item in the picture is the Max cushion. The item received is not the Max cushion with the gray bottom ( Socks came fully black).

reviews.title: The only ones I wear!
reviews.review_text: These socks are the only ones I have worn for years. I don't care for they type that wrap around my calf's. Much cooler in the summer months.

reviews.title: More Cush pkease
reviews.review_text: There used to be a cushioned mens sock with a red Hanes on the toe that was so comfy. This one is not as cushioned.

reviews.title: Ankle socks
reviews.review_text: Socks are comfortable and fit well but wear out quickly. Mine develop holes in the heel within weeks of beginning wearing.

reviews.title: Not as thick as I thought
reviews.review_text: I expected more cushion according to description

reviews.title: Different
reviews.review_text: these are different than the ones I had ordered before. so we'll see.

reviews.title: Not hot enough.
reviews.review_text: Haven't tried them yet. It's not hot enough to wear shorts which is the only time I wear ankle socks. I'm sure they will be very comfortable.

reviews.title: Max Cushionâ€¦.Really?
reviews.review_text: I have 5 year old Hanes socks that have more cushion than these max cushion socks.

reviews.title: Comfy ankle sox for my husband.
reviews.review_text: My husband is disabled and stays inside most of the time. He rarely puts on shoes so I find him in sox. These have the gray bottoms, which take most of the abuse, leaving the 'white' a white I like. Add some peroxide to the white load and they stay looking new.
